00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Balanced traveling salesman problem iterative bottleneck
00003  *          algorithm.
00004  *
00005  * Heuristic for solving the balanced traveling salesman problem iterative
00006  * bottleneck algorithm (BalTSP IB-Algorithm).
00007  *
00008  * @author  John LaRusic
00009  * @ingroup lib
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "common.h"

00019 /**
00020  *  @brief  Calculates the best BTSP lower bound
00021  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00022  *  @param  lower_bound [out] the best lower bound value
00023  */
00024 int 
00025 btsp_lower_bound(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, int *lower_bound);
00026 
00027 /**
00028  *  @brief  Calculates BTSP lower bounds for each unique cost
00029  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00030  *  @param  info [in] problem info
00031  *  @param  max_index [in/out] largest index to bother searching (can change if
00032  *              lower bounds infeasible for some value)
00033  *  @param  btsp_lbs [out] array of BTSP bounds for each cost
00034  *  @param  best_gap [out] smallest gap bound calculated
00035  *  @param  best_low [out] lower cost value for the best gap bound
00036  *  @param  best_high [out] upper cost value for the best gap bound
00037  *  @param  total_time [out] total time spent calculating lower bound values
00038  */
00039 int
00040 btsp_bounds(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, int *max_index, 
00041             int *btsp_lbs, int *best_gap, int *best_low, int *best_high, 
00042             double *total_time);
00043 
00044 /**
00045  *  @brief  Calculates a sorted tree of unique BalTSP lower bounds
00046  *  @param  info [in] problem info
00047  *  @param  btsp_lbs [out] array of BTSP bounds for each cost
00048  *  @param  max_index [in] largest index to bother searching
00049  *  @param  tree [out] sorted tree of unique BalTSP lower bounds
00050  */
00051 int
00052 baltsp_bounds_tree(arrow_problem_info *info, int *btsp_lbs, int max_index, 
00053                    arrow_bintree *tree);
00054 
00055 /**

00060  *  @param  max_index [in] largest index to bother searching

00062  *  @param  num_baltsp_lbs [in] size of baltsp_lbs array
00063  *  @param  tiers [out] array of linked lists to be filled
00064  */
00065 int
00066 fill_tiers(arrow_problem_info *info, int *btsp_lbs, int max_index, 
00067            int *baltsp_lb, int num_baltsp_lbs, arrow_llist *tiers);

00074 int

00082 void

00085 /**
00086  *  @brief  Fills cost_order with a good order for processing them with the 
00087  *          IB-algorithm.
00088  *  @param  info [in] problem info
00089  *  @param  max_index [in] largest index to bother searching
00090  *  @param  btsp_lbs [in] array of BTSP bounds for each cost
00091  *  @param  cost_order [out] specifically ordered array of costs
00092  */
00093 int
00094 find_cost_order(arrow_problem_info *info, int max_index, int *btsp_lbs, int *cost_order);

00096 /****************************************************************************
00097  * Public function implementations
00098  ****************************************************************************/
00099 int 
00100 arrow_balanced_tsp_ib(arrow_problem *problem, 
00101                       arrow_problem_info *info,
00102                       arrow_btsp_params *params, 
00103                       int lb_only, int with_improvements,
00104                       arrow_bound_result *lb_result,
00105                       arrow_btsp_result *tour_result)
00106 {
00107     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00108     int i, k, low_idx;
00109     int best_lb_low, best_lb_high;
00110     int best_tour_low, best_tour_high;
00111     int low_val, max;
00112     int best_gap, cur_gap, lb_gap;
00113     int no_tour_cost;
00114     int *btsp_lbs;
00115     int *cost_order;
00116     double start_time, end_time;
00117     arrow_btsp_fun fun_ib;
00118     arrow_problem *solve_problem;
00119     arrow_problem ib_problem;
00120     arrow_btsp_result cur_tour_result;
00121     
00122     /* Print out debug information */
00123     arrow_debug("LB Only? %s\n", (lb_only ? "Yes" : "No"));
00124     arrow_debug("With Improvements? %s\n", (with_improvements ? "Yes" : "No"));
00125     arrow_debug("Initial Lower Bound: %d\n", params->lower_bound);
00126     arrow_debug("Initial Upper Bound: %d\n", params->upper_bound);
00127     if(params->num_steps > 0)
00128     {
00129         arrow_debug("Total solve steps: %d\n", params->num_steps);
00130     }
00131     arrow_debug("\n");
00132     
00133     /* For future use, possibly, to handle asymmetric instances */
00134     solve_problem = problem;
00135     
00136     /* Setup result structures */
00137     arrow_btsp_result_init(solve_problem, &cur_tour_result);
00138     tour_result->optimal = ARROW_FALSE;
00139     tour_result->found_tour = ARROW_FALSE;
00140     tour_result->total_time = 0.0;
00141     tour_result->bin_search_steps = 0;
00142     for(i = 0; i < ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT; i++)
00143     {
00144         tour_result->solver_attempts[i] = 0;
00145         tour_result->solver_time[i] = 0.0;
00146     }
00147     lb_result->total_time = 0.0;
00148     
00149     best_tour_high = info->max_cost;
00150     best_tour_low = info->min_cost;
00151     
00152     /* Find high values */
00153     if(params->upper_bound == INT_MAX)
00154         params->upper_bound = info->max_cost;
00155     if(!arrow_problem_info_cost_index(info, params->upper_bound, &max))
00156     {
00157         arrow_debug("Could not find upper_bound in cost_list\n");
00158         arrow_debug(" - Using max_cost = %d\n", info->max_cost);
00159         max = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00160     }
00161     
00162     /* Create function for ignoring C[i,j] < low_val */
00163     if(!arrow_baltsp_fun_ib(ARROW_TRUE, &fun_ib))
00164     {
00165         arrow_print_error("Could not create IB transformation function\n");
00166         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00167         goto CLEANUP;
00168     }
00169     
00170     /* Initialize a couple of arrays */
00171     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(max + 1, &btsp_lbs))
00172     {
00173         arrow_print_error("Could not create gap_bound array\n");
00174         btsp_lbs = NULL;
00175         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00176         goto CLEANUP;
00177     }
00178         
00179     /* Calculate BTSP lower bounds for each cost */
00180     if(!btsp_bounds(problem, info, &max, btsp_lbs, &(lb_result->obj_value), 
00181                     &best_lb_low, &best_lb_high, &(lb_result->total_time)))
00182     {
00183         arrow_print_error("Could not calculate gap bounds\n");
00184         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00185         goto CLEANUP;
00186     }
00187     
00188     /* Print values out for debug purposes */
00189     /*
00190     arrow_debug("Balanced TSP Gaps\n");
00191     arrow_debug("i\tz_i\tLB\tGAP\n");
00192     for(i = 0; i <= max; i++)
00193     {
00194         arrow_debug("%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\n", i, info->cost_list[i], btsp_lbs[i], 
00195                     btsp_lbs[i] - info->cost_list[i]);
00196     }
00197     */
00198         
00199     /* Find a good cost order */
00200     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(max + 1, &cost_order))
00201     {
00202         arrow_print_error("Could not create cost_order array\n");
00203         cost_order = NULL;
00204         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00205         goto CLEANUP;
00206     }
00207     if(!find_cost_order(info, max, btsp_lbs, cost_order))
00208     {
00209         arrow_print_error("Could not find good cost order\n");
00210         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00211         goto CLEANUP;
00212     }
00213    
00214     /* Main loop */
00215     if(lb_only) goto CLEANUP;
00216     
00217     arrow_debug("Starting iterative bottleneck search\n");
00218     no_tour_cost = info->max_cost + 1;
00219     for(i = 0; i <= max; i++)
00220     {
00221         low_idx = cost_order[i];
00222         printf("------------------------------------\n");
00223         printf("Cost Index: %d\n", low_idx);
00224         low_val = info->cost_list[low_idx];
00225         printf("C[i,j] >= %d:\n", low_val);
00226         
00227         if(low_val > no_tour_cost)
00228         {
00229             arrow_debug("No tour exists for C[i.j] >= %d, so skip.\n", no_tour_cost);
00230         }
00231         else
00232         {
00233             tour_result->bin_search_steps++;
00234         
00235             lb_gap = btsp_lbs[low_idx] - low_val;
00236             best_gap = best_tour_high - best_tour_low;
00237 
00238             arrow_debug("LB-Gap %d vs. Best-Gap %d\n", lb_gap, best_gap);
00239         
00240             /* Since we solve these problems in order of smallest Balanced TSP gap
00241                to largest, if at any point we notice our best gap is greater than
00242                the lower bound gap, we can quit the search */
00243             if(best_gap <= lb_gap)
00244             {
00245                 arrow_debug("Best known solution better than the current lower bound, so quit.\n");
00246                 break;
00247             }
00248         
00249             /* Create problem that ignores C[i,j] < low_val */
00250             if(!arrow_btsp_fun_apply(&fun_ib, solve_problem, low_val, info->max_cost, &ib_problem))
00251             {
00252                 arrow_debug("Could not create IB cost matrix\n");
00253                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00254                 goto CLEANUP;
00255             }
00256             //printf("fixed_edges in original: %d\n", solve_problem->fixed_edges);
00257             //printf("fixed_edges in ib problem: %d\n", ib_problem.fixed_edges);
00258                 
00259             start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00260             params->lower_bound = btsp_lbs[low_idx];
00261             if(!arrow_btsp_solve(&ib_problem, info, params, &cur_tour_result))
00262             {
00263                 arrow_debug("Error searching for BTSP tour\n");
00264                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00265                 goto CLEANUP;
00266             }
00267             end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00268             tour_result->total_time += end_time - start_time;
00269     
00270             for(k = 0; k < ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT; k++)
00271             {
00272                 tour_result->solver_attempts[k] += cur_tour_result.solver_attempts[k];
00273                 tour_result->solver_time[k] += cur_tour_result.solver_time[k];
00274             }
00275         
00276             arrow_problem_destruct(&ib_problem);
00277     
00278             /* See if we improved the best known gap */
00279             if(cur_tour_result.found_tour)
00280             {
00281                 arrow_debug("Tour exists in [%d,%d] = %d\n", cur_tour_result.min_cost, 
00282                     cur_tour_result.max_cost,
00283                     cur_tour_result.max_cost - cur_tour_result.min_cost);
00284                 
00285                 cur_gap = cur_tour_result.max_cost - cur_tour_result.min_cost;
00286                 if(cur_gap < best_gap)
00287                 {
00288                     arrow_debug("Tour is better than the current best solution.\n");
00289                     tour_result->min_cost = cur_tour_result.min_cost;
00290                     tour_result->max_cost = cur_tour_result.max_cost;
00291                     tour_result->tour_length = cur_tour_result.tour_length;
00292                     tour_result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00293         
00294                     if(tour_result->tour != NULL)
00295                     {
00296                         for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00297                             tour_result->tour[k] = cur_tour_result.tour[k];
00298                     }
00299 
00300                     best_tour_low = cur_tour_result.min_cost;
00301                     best_tour_high = cur_tour_result.max_cost;
00302                 }
00303                 else
00304                 {
00305                     arrow_debug("Tour is no better than the current best solution.\n");
00306                 }
00307             }
00308             else
00309             {
00310                 arrow_debug("Could not find tour\n");
00311                 
00312                 if(low_val < no_tour_cost)
00313                 {
00314                     arrow_debug("no_tour_cost now %d\n", low_val);
00315                     no_tour_cost = low_val;
00316                 }
00317             }
00318         }
00319         arrow_debug("\n");
00320     }
00321     arrow_debug("\n");
00322 
00323 CLEANUP:
00324     if(cost_order != NULL) free(cost_order);
00325     if(btsp_lbs != NULL) free(btsp_lbs);
00326     arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(&fun_ib);
00327     arrow_btsp_result_destruct(&cur_tour_result);
00328     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 /****************************************************************************
00333  * Private function implementations
00334  ****************************************************************************/
00335 int 
00336 btsp_lower_bound(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00337                  int *lower_bound)
00338 {
00339     arrow_bound_result result;
00340     
00341     if(!arrow_bbssp_solve(problem, info, &result))
00342     {
00343         arrow_debug("Error finding BBSSP lower bound\n");
00344         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00345     }
00346     *lower_bound = result.obj_value;
00347     
00348     if(!arrow_bap_solve(problem, info, &result))
00349     {
00350         arrow_debug("Error finding BAP lower bound\n");
00351         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00352     }
00353     if(result.obj_value < *lower_bound)
00354         *lower_bound = result.obj_value;
00355         
00356     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00357 }
00358 
00359 int
00360 btsp_bounds(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, int *max_index, 
00361             int *btsp_lbs, int *best_gap, int *best_low, int *best_high, 
00362             double *total_time)
00363 {
00364     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00365     int i;
00366     int cost;
00367     int lb;
00368     int gap;
00369     double start_time;
00370     double end_time;
00371     arrow_btsp_fun fun_ib;
00372     arrow_problem ib_problem;
00373     
00374     /* Create function for ignoring C[i,j] < low_val */
00375     if(!arrow_baltsp_fun_ib(ARROW_TRUE, &fun_ib))
00376     {
00377         arrow_print_error("Could not create IB transformation function\n");
00378         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00379         goto CLEANUP;
00380     }
00381     
00382     *best_gap = INT_MAX;
00383     *total_time = 0.0;
00384     
00385     for(i = 0; i <= *max_index; i++)
00386     {
00387         cost = info->cost_list[i];
00388         
00389         /* Create problem that ignores C[i,j] < low_val */
00390         if(!arrow_btsp_fun_apply(&fun_ib, problem, cost, info->max_cost, &ib_problem))
00391         {
00392             arrow_print_error("Could not create IB cost matrix\n");
00393             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00394             goto CLEANUP;
00395         }
00396         
00397         /* Calculate lower bound */
00398         start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00399         if(!btsp_lower_bound(&ib_problem, info, &lb))
00400         {
00401             arrow_print_error("Error finding BTSP lower bound\n");
00402             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00403             goto CLEANUP;
00404         }
00405         end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00406         *total_time += (end_time - start_time);
00407         
00408         /* A negative value indicates an infeasible lower bound, so we quit here */
00409         if(lb < 0)
00410         {
00411             arrow_debug("Negative value for the lower bound #%d, so quit\n", i);
00412             arrow_debug("Old Max Index Value: %d\n", *max_index);
00413             *max_index = i - 1;
00414             arrow_debug("New Max Index Value: %d\n", *max_index);
00415             break;
00416         }
00417         
00418         /* Store calculated value for later, update best lower bound */
00419         gap = lb - cost;
00420         btsp_lbs[i] = lb;
00421         arrow_debug("C[i,j] >= %d: %d ", cost, lb);
00422         if(gap < *best_gap)
00423         {
00424             arrow_debug("Improved!");
00425             *best_low = cost;
00426             *best_high = lb;
00427             *best_gap = gap;
00428         }
00429         arrow_debug("\n");
00430         
00431         /* Destroy problem */
00432         arrow_problem_destruct(&ib_problem);
00433     }
00434     arrow_debug("\n");
00435 
00436 CLEANUP:
00437     arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(&fun_ib);
00438     return ret;
00439 }
00440 
00441 int
00442 baltsp_bounds_tree(arrow_problem_info *info, int *btsp_lbs, int max_index, 
00443                    arrow_bintree *tree)
00444 {
00445     int i;
00446     
00447     /* Sort the unique gap values */
00448     arrow_bintree_init(tree);        
00449     for(i = 0; i <= max_index; i++)
00450     {    
00451         if(!arrow_bintree_insert(tree, btsp_lbs[i] - info->cost_list[i]))
00452         {
00453             arrow_print_error("Could not sort BalTSP lower bounds");
00454             arrow_bintree_destruct(tree);
00455             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00456         }
00457     }
00458     
00459     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00460 }
00461 
00462 int
00463 fill_tiers(arrow_problem_info *info, int *btsp_lbs, int max_index, 
00464            int *baltsp_lb, int num_baltsp_lbs, arrow_llist *tiers)
00465 {
00466     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00467     int i;
00468     int cost;
00469     int gap;
00470     int idx;
00471     arrow_hash hash;
00472     arrow_llist *list;
00473     
00474     /* Create a hash of the unique values */
00475     if(!arrow_hash_cost_list(baltsp_lb, num_baltsp_lbs, &hash))
00476     {
00477         arrow_print_error("Could not create hash of unique BalTSP bounds");
00478         goto CLEANUP;
00479     }
00480     
00481     for(i = 0; i <= max_index; i++)
00482     {
00483         cost = info->cost_list[i];
00484         gap = btsp_lbs[i] - cost;
00485         idx = arrow_hash_search(&hash, gap);
00486         
00487         list = &(tiers[idx]);
00488         arrow_llist_insert_tail(list, i);
00489     }
00490 
00491 CLEANUP:
00492     arrow_hash_destruct(&hash);
00493     return ret;
00494 }
00495 
00496 int
00497 init_tiers(int num_tiers, arrow_llist **tiers)
00498 {
00499     int i;
00500     arrow_llist *tier;
00501     
00502     /* Allocate memory */
00503     if((*tiers = malloc(num_tiers * sizeof(arrow_llist))) == NULL)
00504     {
00505         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for array of linked lists.");
00506         *tiers = NULL;
00507         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00508     }
00509     
00510     /* Initialize lists */
00511     for(i = 0; i < num_tiers; i++)
00512     {
00513         tier = &((*tiers)[i]);
00514         arrow_llist_init(tier);
00515     }
00516     
00517     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00518 }
00519 
00520 void
00521 destruct_tiers(int num_tiers, arrow_llist **tiers)
00522 {
00523     int i;
00524     arrow_llist *tier;
00525     
00526     if(*tiers != NULL)
00527     {
00528         for(i = 0; i < num_tiers; i++)
00529         {
00530             tier = &((*tiers)[i]);
00531             arrow_llist_destruct(tier);
00532         }
00533         free(*tiers);
00534     }
00535 }
00536 
00537 int
00538 find_cost_order(arrow_problem_info *info, int max_index, int *btsp_lbs, int *cost_order)
00539 {
00540     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00541     int i, k;
00542     int idx;
00543     int *baltsp_lbs;
00544     int num_tiers;
00545     arrow_llist *tier;
00546     arrow_llist *tiers;
00547     arrow_bintree tree;
00548         
00549     /* Find a list of unique BalTSP lower bounds */
00550     if(!baltsp_bounds_tree(info, btsp_lbs, max_index, &tree))
00551     {
00552         arrow_print_error("Could not create BalTSP bounds list");
00553         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00554     }
00555     
00556     /* Create array for holding Balanced TSP lower bounds */
00557     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(tree.size, &baltsp_lbs))
00558     {
00559         arrow_print_error("Could not create baltsp_lbs array\n");
00560         baltsp_lbs = NULL;
00561         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00562         goto CLEANUP;
00563     }
00564     
00565     /* Convert tree to an array */
00566     arrow_bintree_to_array(&tree, baltsp_lbs);
00567     num_tiers = tree.size;
00568     
00569     /* Create and fill the list of tiers with costs corresponding to each 
00570        BalTSP lower bound */
00571     if(!init_tiers(num_tiers, &tiers))
00572     {
00573         arrow_print_error("Could not create tiers of linked lists");
00574         tiers = NULL;
00575         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00576         goto CLEANUP;
00577     }
00578     if(!fill_tiers(info, btsp_lbs, max_index, baltsp_lbs, num_tiers, tiers))
00579     {
00580         arrow_print_error("Could not fill tiers of linked lists");
00581         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00582         goto CLEANUP;
00583     }
00584     
00585     /* Fill cost_order according to order in tiers */
00586     i = 0;
00587     for(k = 0; k < num_tiers; k++)
00588     {
00589         tier = &(tiers[k]);
00590         while(tier->size > 0)
00591         {
00592             arrow_llist_remove_head(tier, &idx);
00593             cost_order[i] = idx;
00594             i++;
00595         }
00596     }
00597 
00598     /*
00599     arrow_debug("Cost index order: ");
00600     for(i = 0; i <= max_index; i++)
00601         arrow_debug("%d, ", cost_order[i]);
00602     arrow_debug("EOL\n\n");
00603     */
00604          
00605 CLEANUP:
00606     free(baltsp_lbs);
00607     destruct_tiers(num_tiers, &tiers);
00608     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00609     return ret;
00610 }
